New Records: Juan Soto hit a 402-foot three-run homer in the 10th inning, securing the Yankees' 5-2 victory over the Guardians in Game 5 of the American League Championship Series.
Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton launched a game-tying, two-run homer off Tanner Bibee in the sixth inning
Juan Soto blasted a go-ahead three-run homer in the 10th that helped secure the Yankees' 5-2 victory
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees needed four more victories to claim the 28th World Series title in franchise history
Manager Aaron Boone described the team's journey as'very special'
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Aaron Boone highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees will face the winner of the Dodgers/Mets NLCS in the Fall Classic beginning on Friday
The Yankees acquired Juan Soto in exchange for a five-player package to the Padres in December
